MemoryInfobox.description: 'Enticed by the mysterious Elpenor, Kassandra accepted his request to retrieve the mythical Shroud of Penelope|shroud of Penelope. its recovery, said Elpenor, was crucial, and Kassandra was determined to find out why.'

General_Description: '''Penelope's Shroud''' was a virtual representation of one of the [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: Kassandra accepted the mysterious [[Elpenor]]'s request to recover the [[Shroud of Penelope]].
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra departed the shore and [[Elpenor]] to recover [[Penelope]]'s Shroud. The island of [[Ithaka]] rested across the waters.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Headed to Odysseus's island on a tiny boat. Let’s try not to piss off [[Poseidon]], shall we?''
Working through the ruins of [[Odysseus]]' [[Odysseus' Palace|Palace]], Kassandra came across [[Odessa]], imprisoned in a [[wood]]en cage. Kassandra freed Odessa after killing the guards.
*'''Odessa:''' ''Hey, get me out of here!''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Let's get out of here. Can you fight?''
*'''Odessa:''' ''I'd be ''happy'' to.''
(The above continues with the side quest [[A Small Odyssey]])

Kassandra found the shroud, intending to escape the Palace.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Penelope's shroud. In the flesh. I mean cloth.''
Having found the shroud, Kassandra left Ithaka and travelled to the [[Temple of Zeus (Kephallonia)|Temple of Zeus]] near [[Sami]]. There, she found Elpenor and his servant.
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Kassandra. Good news, I hope.''
[[File:ACOD_Penelope's_Shroud_-_Kassandra_Handing_Over_Shroud.png|thumb|250px|Kassandra with the shroud]]
Kassandra took out the shroud.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Safe and sound.''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Well done. And now the shroud is yours.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You don't want it? After all that?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''I gained something more valuable today. For your troubles, ''[[Mercenary|misthios]]''.''
Elpenor's servant tossed a bag of coins to the table before Kassandra.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''If I knew any better, I'd think you were testing me.''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Perhaps.''
The servant then handed Kassandra a scroll.
*'''Elpenor:''' ''You did well, ''misthios''. Tell me, how do you feel about killing a general in [[Megaris]]? Do this for me, and earn ''double'' what you earned today. Are you up to the task? It would take you far away from [[Kephallonia]]. So far away you might never return.''
<tabber>
|-|Military ranks mean nothing to me.=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Generals bleed like anyone else.''
*'''Elpinor:''' ''Good.''
|-|I'm a misthios, not an assassin.=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I'm not an assassin.''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''There's a first time for everything.''
</tabber>
*'''Elpenor:''' ''What do you say?''
(If players choose "Who is the general I have to kill?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Who is this general?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''They call him "[[Nikolaos|The Wolf]]."''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''He do something to offend you?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Yes... He's costing me drachmae. He's not good for business.''
(If players choose "What can you tell me about Megaris?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Anything I should know about Megaris?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Only that it's the most valuable land in the [[Greece|Greek]] world, from a military perspective of course. Unfortunately for Megarians, it has two very powerful neighbors who just can't seem to play nice. In the tug of war between [[Korinth]] and [[Athens]], Megaris is the rope.''
(If players choose "Why choose me?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Why me?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Because no one knows who you are. You're invisible.''
(If players choose "I'll take the contract.")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I accept.''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Splendid. You'll need a boat. You have one, don't you?''
<tabber>
|-|I have a boat.=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Of course.''
|-|I don't have a boat.=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''If I had a boat, we wouldn't be having this conversation.''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''A shame. It's too far of a swim I'm afraid, even for you.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I'll find one.''
</tabber>
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Good. I hope it's sturdy.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''And why is that?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''The seas are much more dangerous, I'm afraid. [[Peloponnesian War|War]] is coming, and the Wolf is on the wrong side.''
(If players choose "What war?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''War? With who?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''The entire Greek world is at each other's throats. What rock have you been hiding under, exactly?''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Kephallonia.''
(If players choose "Why should I trust you?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''And how do I know you're on the right side?''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''Because I'm the one paying you.''
(If players choose"I'm right for the job.")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You won't be disappointed.''
*'''Elpenor:''' ''When your job in Megaris is done, come find me at [[Pilgrim's Landing]] in [[Phokis]].''
Section_Outcome: Kassandra helped Elpenor to recover Penelope's shroud, but was offered to keep it instead. Elpenor offered her a contract to hunt down a general known as the Wolf.
